title: Trig Derivative Cycle
description: Interactive visualization showing the cyclic pattern of trigonometric derivatives. Demonstrates how taking the derivative of sin(x) produces cos(x), then -sin(x), then -cos(x), and finally back to sin(x) after four derivatives.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Trigonometry
Derivatives
Trigonometric Functions
prerequisites: Familiarity with sine and cosine functions

controls.label: Take Derivative
controls.action: Advances to the next function in the derivative cycle

controls.label: Reset
controls.action: Returns to sin(x) as the starting function

controls.label: Show Both Graphs
controls.action: Toggles display of both f(x) and f'(x) graphs simultaneously
